definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way

sentences.english: In his letter of resignation, the General admitted that he has become a liability to the president.
sentences.chinese: 在辞职信中，将军承认他已经成为总统的绊脚石。

sentences.english: The stumbling block lies with their conflicting views of space and time.
sentences.chinese: 绊脚石正是它们对空间和时间观念的冲突。

sentences.english: Diapers seem to be a stumbling block for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 尿片似乎对所有人来说都是个绊脚石。

sentences.english: Please don't move that stumbling block, but lead me , Lord, around it.
sentences.chinese: 上帝，请不要搬开那块绊脚石，指引我绕开它。

sentences.english: He flung himself resolutely into the tangle of undergrowth.
sentences.chinese: 他果断地钻进了缠手绊脚的荆棘丛。

sentences.english: I know this is my biggest stumbling block.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这是我最大的绊脚石。

sentences.english: The next rock in your path may be a stepping stone.
sentences.chinese: 也许人生路上的下一个绊脚石就是垫脚石。

sentences.english: Overstaffing has become the obstacle for reforms.
sentences.chinese: 人浮于事已成为改革的绊脚石。

sentences.english: But it can also be destructive, and become an obstacle to success.
sentences.chinese: 但竞争也具有破坏性，成为阻碍成功的绊脚石。

sentences.english: Wilfulness is the stumbling block in a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 任性，刁蛮是婚姻的绊脚石。

sentences.english: Agriculture continues to be the main stumbling block to a deal.
sentences.chinese: 农业仍旧是达成协议最大的绊脚石。

sentences.english: Second-guessing is what gets in the way of a writer’s ability to write faster.
sentences.chinese: “推敲”是阻碍作者写得更快的绊脚石。

sentences.english: Articles and prepositions are stumbling blocks to the beginners of English.
sentences.chinese: 冠词和介系词对英文初学者来说是个绊脚石。

sentences.english: The key to success is to turn blocking stone into stepping-stone.
sentences.chinese: 人生的一大秘诀就是将绊脚石变成垫脚石。

sentences.english: Our CM tool was a stumbling block in this project.
sentences.chinese: 我们的配置管理工具是我们这个项目的一块绊脚石。

sentences.english: Pride is a stumbling block to real progress.
sentences.chinese: 骄傲自满是真正取得进步的绊脚石。

definition: to fall down/to take a fall
to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
(usu used in the negative) to be of importance or to matter/to be in the way/to be a hindrance
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
